The claim specifically refers to the M: DD-YY format and does not apply to other date formats such as DD-MM-YY or MM-DD-YYYY.
September 2019 will have 10 palindrome d: not seven, making it a "palindrome week" rather than a week with only seven palindrome dates.
Palindrome weeks: where consecutive palindrome dates occur, have been observed in previous years as well, with 10 consecutive palindrome dates occurring every year since 2011.
